conclusion: A 5m wooden rod is suspended from a fixed point, released from rest, falls freely, and point A is 20m below the suspension point.
We need to find t₁, the time when the bottom end of the rod passes through point A.
The rod falls under gravity with acceleration g = 10 m/s².
Set up the coordinate system with y = 0 at the suspension point (positive downward).
Position as a function of time for an object falling from rest under gravity: y(t) = (1/2)gt².
The bottom end of the rod is 5m below the top end, so its position is y(t) + 5m.
Point A is 20m below the suspension point, find t₁ such that y(t₁) + 5m = 20m.
Solve for t₁: y(t₁) = 15m, (1/2)gt₁² = 15m, 5t₁² = 15, t₁² = 3, t₁ = √3 ≈ 1.732 seconds.
The time it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is t₁ = √3 seconds or approximately 1.732 seconds.
